level.heading: Employer's receipt of income-withholding order of another state.
level.text: An income-withholding order issued in another state may be sent by or on behalf of the obligee, or by the support enforcement agency, to the person defined as the obligor's employer under Chapter 2 of this title, without first filing a petition or comparable pleading or registering the order with a tribunal of the District.

level.heading: Effect of Amendments
level.text: D.C. Law 16-137 substituted "sent by or on behalf of the obligee, or by the support enforcement agency, to the person" for "sent to the person or entity".

level.heading: Temporary Amendment of Section
level.text: For temporary (225 day) amendment of section, see § 2(i) of Uniform Interstate Family Support Temporary Amendment Act of 1998 (D.C. Law 12-94, April 29, 1998, law notification 45 DCR 2785).

level.heading: Emergency Legislation
level.text: For temporary amendment of subchapter, see § 2(i) of the Uniform Interstate Family Support Emergency Amendment Act of 1997 (D.C. Act 12-225, December 23, 1997, 45 DCR 151).
For temporary amendment of section, see § 2(i) of the Uniform Interstate Family Support Emergency Amendment Act of 1997 (D.C. Act 12-225, December 23, 1997, 45 DCR 151).
For temporary amendment of subchapter heading, see § 2(i) of the Uniform Interstate Family Support Congressional Review Emergency Amendment Act of 1998 (D.C. Act 12-310, March 20, 1998, 45 DCR 1950).
For temporary amendment of section, see § 2(i) of the Uniform Interstate Family Support Congressional Review Emergency Amendment Act of 1998 (D.C. Act 12-310, March 20, 1998, 45 DCR 1950).

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 11-81
level.text: For legislative history of D.C. Law 11-81, see Historical and Statutory Notes following § 46-301.01.

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 12-94
level.text: For legislative history of D.C. Law 12-94, see Historical and Statutory Notes following § 46-301.01.

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 12-131
level.text: For legislative history of D.C. Law 12-131, see Historical and Statutory Notes following § 46-301.01.

level.heading: Effective Dates
level.text: Applicability: Section 3 of D.C. Law 16-137 provided: "This act shall apply as of April 1, 2007."

level.heading: Editor's Notes
level.text: Uniform Law: This section is based upon § 501 of the Uniform Interstate Family Support Act (2001 Act).
